meanings.definition: The state of being derived from a single common ancestor.
meanings.sent1: Monophyly means all the animals in the family tree come from one grandparent.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study monophyly to understand how different species are related to each other.
meanings.sent3: At the family reunion, the concept of monophyly was a hot topic among the relatives.
meanings.sent4: The idea of monophyly is like a tree with all its branches stemming from a single root.
meanings.sent5: In the story of evolution, monophyly is the tale of a single ancestor giving rise to a diverse family tree.

meanings.definition: A group of organisms that includes an ancestral species and all of its descendants.
meanings.sent1: The monophyly of the bird species includes all birds and their common ancestor.
meanings.sent2: The monophyly of mammals encompasses all mammals and their shared forebear.
meanings.sent3: The monophyly of the insect group made for an interesting biology lesson.
meanings.sent4: The monophyly of plants is like a big family tree with the original plant at the root.
meanings.sent5: Learning about the monophyly of fish helps us understand their evolutionary history better.
